page.title: 14STREETS AND BUILDINGS xii.
page.content: The Square. Overlooked by the ancient stones of the Saxon Tower and Norman Church standing on their Prehistoric castle mound, the crossroads known as the Square is the hub of Earls Barton. Several yards give their address as The Square,and in these yards many small businesses thrive- carpenters, funeral directors,model-makers,dental technicians and trades allied to the boot and shoe industry. Shops and banks surround the Green on which until the turn of the century stood the parish pump.Three of the main banks maintain busy branches,and several Building Societies exist round the Square.A large and busy Post Office faces the church.The commercial centre of the village is completed with a Fish and Chip Shop,hairdressers,Restaurant, Chemists,Butchers and Doctors Surgery.
